Interface PlayerStrategy

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    NaivePlayer, Player, SmartPlayer, VerySmartPlayer

    public interface PlayerStrategy
    An interface that specifies how a player interacts with the game engine. Specifically, the game engine provides information to the player and requests (through the 'doTurn' method) how the player responds. Created by zilles on 2/28/17.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Play doTurn(Hand hand)
      The method invoked on a player each time it is their turn to act.
      void initialize(int yourPlayerNumber, int totalNumberOfPlayers)
      The first function called on the object to provide information that is true for the whole execution.
      void playOccurred(RecordedPlay recordedPlay)
      Every time a game action takes place, the game engine invokes the following function on each player.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize(int yourPlayerNumber,
                int totalNumberOfPlayers)
        The first function called on the object to provide information that is true for the whole execution.
        Parameters:
        yourPlayerNumber - a number between 0 and (totalNumberOfPlayers - 1) specifying the current player
        totalNumberOfPlayers - a positive integer indicating the total number of players in the game

      • doTurn

        Play doTurn(Hand hand)
        The method invoked on a player each time it is their turn to act.
        Parameters:
        hand - The current state of the player's hand when they are to act
        Returns:
        The action they choose to take in response to their current hand/game state

      • playOccurred

        void playOccurred(RecordedPlay recordedPlay)
        Every time a game action takes place, the game engine invokes the following function on each player.
        Parameters:
        recordedPlay - an object representing the information of the play that just occurred and its results.
